item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 17, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Deep Learning Is Not So Mysterious or Different (85 points | 10 comments)
2. Show HN: Localscope–Limit scope of Python functions for reproducible execution (15 points | 5 comments)
3. Alphabet spins out Taara – Internet over lasers (15 points | 7 comments)
4. Launching RDAP; sunsetting WHOIS (776 points | 301 comments)
5. Darker Than a Dark Pool? Welcome to Wall Street's 'Private Rooms' (48 points | 22 comments)
6. Ogres Are Cool (65 points | 19 comments)
7. Extracting content from an LCP "protected" ePub (83 points | 21 comments)
8. Piramidal (YC W24) is hiring a ML Engineer to decode brainwaves ( | hide)
9. Chaos in the Cloudflare Lisbon Office (145 points | 57 comments)
10. LAPD Surveilled Gaza Protests Using This Social Media Tool (25 points | 16 comments)
11. Show HN: EnkiTask: Lightweight Project Management for Freelancers (54 points | 37 comments)
12. The exceptional Jordan algebra (2020) (87 points | 10 comments)
13. Raspberry Pi RP2350 Now Available for Purchase, Stacked Memory Variant Coming (111 points | 46 comments)
14. Underware 2.0 – Open Source Infinite Cable Management (56 points | 13 comments)
15. Copyright and the Demo Scene (21 points | 3 comments)
16. Undergraduate Disproves 40-Year-Old Conjecture, Invents New Kind of Hash Table (128 points | 60 comments)
17. Compression of Spectral Images Using Spectral JPEG XL (61 points | 11 comments)
18. Recommendations for designing magic numbers of binary file formats (125 points | 33 comments)
19. Coq-of-rust: Formal verification tool for Rust (48 points | 6 comments)
20. Conducting forensics of mobile devices to find signs of a potential compromise (121 points | 26 comments)
21. Going down the rabbit hole of Git's new bundle-URI (260 points | 85 comments)
22. Genomic study: our capacity for language emerged at least 135k years ago (74 points | 47 comments)
23. HTTP/3 is everywhere but nowhere (220 points | 204 comments)
24. Checkers written in Rust and exported to WASM (85 points | 33 comments)
25. Image Processing in C – Dwayne Phillips [pdf] (107 points | 18 comments)
26. Akira ransomware can be cracked with sixteen RTX 4090 GPUs in around ten hours (81 points | 26 comments)
27. Converting C to ASM to specs and then to a working Z/80 Speccy tape (62 points | 63 comments)
28. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (1720 points | 430 comments)
29. The Alexa feature "do not send voice recordings" you enabled no longer available (781 points | 543 comments)
30. Zlib-rs is faster than C (307 points | 413 comments)
